pr_title: [WFLY-12952] Register default readiness probe for deployment

timeline.bodyText: In the context of other MP specs I've seen a particular pattern of config property keys used for impl-specific config properties (something like mp..extension. -- @pferraro knows).  Is there such a thing for health? If not is it wise to act is if there was?
timeline.author: bstansberry

replies.bodyText:
I'm not sure to understand your comment.
This property mp.health.disable-default-procedures is defined by the spec itself
replies.author: jmesnil

timeline.message:
[WFLY-12952] Register default readiness probe for deployment

When a deployment does not provide any MicroProfile readiness probe,
add a default one (which returns UP as long as the deployment is deployed).

This allow to configure the overall server readiness to be DOWN when
the server is started and becomes UP as soon as a deployment is
deployed.

This default probe is disabled when the MicroProfile Health TCK is run.

JIRA: https://issues.redhat.com/browse/WFLY-12952
